page.title: 06CULMSTOCK PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: This ia a PRIMARY SCHOOL, founded in 1876, catering for 75 children between the ages of 5 and ll. It has 3 Classes, namely,(1) - 20 pupils aged 9-11, (2) - 24 pupils aged 7-9 and (3) -31 pupils aged 5-7. Staff comprises the Headmaster, who also teaches, two teachers and one part-time teacher (one day per week).Application was made under the Elementary Education Act 1870 for a loan for the erection of the School with house attached. This was granted in October 1875, the loan Â£1,400 to be repaid over 50 years at an annual instalment of Â£4.5s.3d. Facilities include an Outdoor Swimming Pool, Electric Pottery Kiln, Television, Library and Computer. Use is made of the nearby Village Hall for recreational purposes and as a Dining Hall.
